insertShortcutTable.caption: General
insertShortcutTable.description: Mapping shortcuts perform commands on the active map or scene view, such as adding data, viewing attributes, working with selections, and navigation, or saving locations in the view.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Exploratory Analysis Tools
insertShortcutTable.description: Exploratory analysis tool shortcuts reposition and rotate analysis objects in the active scene.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Graphics: Auto Text
insertShortcutTable.description: Available when creating text graphics with the Auto Text tool.

insertShortcutTable.caption: General Navigation
insertShortcutTable.description: View navigation shortcuts perform specific navigation actions within an active view.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Stereo Navigation
insertShortcutTable.description: View navigation shortcuts perform specific navigation actions within an active view.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Snapping
insertShortcutTable.description: Available when sketching and snapping is on.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Animation
insertShortcutTable.description: Animation shortcuts perform commands on an animation in the active view, including appending and playing through keyframes.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Range
insertShortcutTable.description: Range shortcuts step through or play an active range in the active map or scene.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Time
insertShortcutTable.description: Time shortcuts step through or play time in the active map or scene.

insertShortcutTable.caption: Stereo
insertShortcutTable.description: Stereo shortcuts supports easy loading, navigation, and stereoscopic analysis of imagery in the Stereo window.

content.searchDescription: This skill class allows users to manage map layers in ArcGIS Pro, including adding data, zooming to layers or coordinates, applying symbology, and creating camera animations. Users can also control layer visibility, edit animation timelines, and change the view of the active 3D map view.

aiAssistantFunction.name: GetFieldDescriptionsFromLayer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Returns a list of field names and field types from the table used by the specified layer.

aiAssistantFunction.name: GetAllLayers
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Returns a list of all layers in the active map.

aiAssistantFunction.name: FindLayerFromLayerIndex
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Returns the layer information about layer in the current map by using the index or position of the layer specified by the user.

aiAssistantFunction.name: OpenFieldsViewForLayer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Opens the fields view for the specified layer.

aiAssistantFunction.name: UpdateLayerProperty
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: For a given layer or layers, updates layer properties like expanded state, toggle display filters, layer type, maximum scale, minimum scale, show legends, transparency, visibility, show popups, searchablility, show map tips, selectablility, label visibility, scale symbols, layer blending mode, per feature blending mode for feature layers, editability for layer data, snappability, show layers at all scales, disable scales, toggles auto generate templates.

aiAssistantFunction.name: ZoomToLayer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Zooms the active map view to the bounds of the specified layer name.

aiAssistantFunction.name: SetLayerVisibility
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Shows or hides a layer in the active map.

aiAssistantFunction.name: RemoveLayer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Removes the layer from the active map.

content.searchDescription: Used to apply and modify the symbology of feature layers

aiAssistantFunction.name: GetCurrentRendererType
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Returns the current renderer type of feature layer.

aiAssistantFunction.name: UpdateRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Changes or updates symbology or drawing of the feature layer by changing the properties of the current renderer like symbol, symbol color, symbol size, and several others.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateUniqueValueRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates unique value renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer the feature layer with a different unique qualitative symbols for each type or category based on one two or three fields or an expression.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateGraduatedColorsRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates graduated colors renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer the feature layer with classified quantitative symbols that vary in color lighter darker or diverging based on a field or expression.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateGraduatedSymbolsRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates graduated symbols renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer the feature layer with classified quantitative symbols that vary in size larger or smaller based on a field or expression.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateSimpleRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates simple renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer all features in the feature layer with the one symbol.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateProportionalRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates proportional renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer the feature layer with quantitative symbols that vary in size larger or smaller proportional or relative to values from a field or expression.

aiAssistantFunction.name: CreateDotDensityRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Creates dot density renderer to symbolize or draw or visualize or renderer the feature layer with randomly spaced quantitative dot symbols that represent values from fields or expressions.

content.searchDescription: Used to search the styles in the projects for style items like symbols, color ramps, etc.

aiAssistantFunction.name: FindStyleItemForRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Finds available symbols or other style items that match a search string.

aiAssistantFunction.name: SearchStyles
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Finds available symbols or other style items that match a search string.

aiAssistantFunction.name: FindColorRampItemForRenderer
aiAssistantFunction.searchDescription: Finds a color ramp that be used for the specified renderer type.

content.name: Query Layer
content.onboardingMessage:
**Query Layer**
Create and add a Query Layer to your map:
1. **Select a database and tables**
Choose a database and tables from the Data context drop downs below. Only workspaces that support query layer access are available.
2. **Describe your query in natural language**
For example, if you had a database of US counties with population attributes, you could ask for "all the counties with population below 24000".
3. **Notes**
Use field names or aliases that exist in the underlying table as part of the question.
SQL query is generated based on the schema and not the values stored in the table.
content.promptHint: Ask a question or type / for commands. Use Ctrl + Up or Down arrows to scroll previous questions.
content.tooltip: Help me create a query layer

button.caption: Achromatopsia (full-color-blind)
button.tooltip: Activate achromatopsia mode which simulates full-color-blind vision. In this color vision mode, only monochromatic gray hues are visible.

button.caption: Color Vision Simulator
button.tooltip: The active mode simulates the view as if color blind in one of four primary conditions; green-blind, red-blind, blue-blind, or full-color-blind.

button.tooltip: Achieve better performance at the expense of labeling quality. This option is useful when initially setting up the labeling properties.Disabled if the current map is not labeled with Maplex.

button.caption: Convert Labels To Annotation...
button.tooltip: Convert labels to annotation. Annotation allows individual text graphics to be edited and stored in the geodatabase.Disabled if the current map is not labeled.

button.tooltip: Convert labels to graphics. Allows individual text graphics to be edited and stored in a graphics layer.Disabled if the current map is not labeled.

button.caption: Enable Location
button.tooltip: Show the current location of the connected device on the map or scene. This also enables the Device Location tab where you can adjust GNSS and navigation settings. There is no active map or no active device connection. Connect to a device from the Device Location tab in the ArcGIS Pro Settings page.

button.caption: Location Details
button.tooltip: Open the Device Location pane to view GNSS information, satellite locations and signal strength, or log location data. No device connection is active. Connect to a device from the Device Location tab in the ArcGIS Pro Settings page.

checkBox.tooltip: Show a circular buffer around the location of the connected device on the map or scene to represent the accuracy of the device's position. The Show Location check box must be checked to edit this setting.

button.caption: Locked Ranges

Enable or disable the locked range filters stored in range-aware layers.
For layers with more than one range, inactive ranges are in a locked state where they act as additional definition queries for the layer.

comboBox.caption: Active Range

checkBox.caption: Single Value
checkBox.tooltip:
View and interact with the current range using a single-value picker control.
The range span will be set to ‘0’, and the range step size will be set to ‘1’. This mode is well-suited for stepping through a discrete integer range, such as the individual floors of a building or an ordered set of classification codes.

customControl.caption: Download Map
customControl.tooltip:
Take web feature and tile layers offline to complete your work without a network connection. The features and tiles within the visible area of the map will be downloaded. You cannot work with the map while its data is downloading.
You can take a map offline when it has web feature and web tile layers that are configured to support this operation. This command is disabled if working with Portal Projects.

button.caption: Scale Range
button.tooltip: Limit the visible range of the layer by specifying the largest scale (most closely zoomed in) and smallest (farthest zoomed out) scales at which the layer is visible. The layer does not draw outside this scale range.

button.caption: Flicker
button.tooltip: Display the layers underneath a particular layer by quickly turning it on and off. This is useful for temporal change detection (especially of satellite images or aerial photographs taken at different times of the same location), data quality comparison, and other analysis where you want to see the difference between layers.In a 2D map, select one or more visible layers. In a 3D scene, select one or more visible 3D layers, or select a surface, like Ground.

button.tooltip: Enables the feature to cast a shadow based on the illumination setting in the scene properties.This command is currently unavailable. Display shadows in 3D setting is unchecked in the scene properties. Right-click the scene in the Contents pane and click properties and check the property on the Illumination page.

checkBox.tooltip: Show track lines to connect observations.Track lines can only be shown for point stream layers that are track aware and whose source stream service type is spatial.

customControl.tooltip: Apply a visual effect to the selected layers to blend with layers lower in the draw order.The selected layers must be in a map or in the 2D category of a scene to participate in layer blending. Sublayers of a composite layer that are dependent on the composite layer for drawing are ignored.

Apply a visual effect to features in the selected layer to blend them with overlapping features in the same layer.The selected layers must be annotation layers, dimension layers, or feature layers with a data source other than a stream service.
